review.reviewText: We were put in a handicap room where we could not even control the thermostat.  Small dingy room.  After complaining, they put us in a better room the next day.

review.title: the best option but price high
review.reviewText: People at the registration very nice hotel breakfast very good. Problem getting luggage to the second floor
The hotel is in need of some renovation, the hallway carpets are hot mess with fading and worn out spots but overall it's a great place to stay.

review.title: Wet carpet
review.reviewText: When we arrived, our bathroom floor was a little slick.  We later found out that our carpet was wet, as if it had just been shampooed earlier in the day.   Who rents out hotel rooms hours after cleaning the carpet?

review.title: In the right place at the right time
review.reviewText: Adequate hotel plenty for breakfast and tasty, room OK but the carpet was filthy, badly in need of a deep clean not just a vacuum.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient and fairly priced.
review.negativeRemarks: Carpets cleaned
review.locationRemarks: Seaplane Adventures and only 10 mins from the Golden Gate Bridge.

review.reviewText: Breakfast was good,and hotel was close to San Francisco.

review.title: Close to walking/bike paths
review.reviewText: Great location. Quick drive over golden gate to get into San Fran. Hotel close to great walking and biking paths. They provide free bikes for 2 hours. Close to Sausalito.

review.title: disappointing room
review.reviewText: The hotel room was terrible, had an odd smell In the hallways and bathrooms. The bed was super hard, like sleeping on a sidewalk. The place could use a huge remodel, which it looks like as if they maybe doing in the other side of the hotel.The rooms were not very clean, dirt built up behind the doors and on the baseboards, windows were gross, and there was a dark liquid stain I believe was soda had ran down a wall and dried. There was trash, empty beer bottles and cigarette butts out on the patio of our room.The positives are they had a great free breakfast every morning; bikes for the hotel guests to use, which is great for all of the paths around the hotel; and its an easy convenient walk to a bus stop location, that will take you to just about anywhere you want to go. The staff was okay, I can not say they did anything wrong. However, they did not do anything to standout and make you feel welcome.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is in a great location. The walking paths around the hotel are amazing, we walked them almost every evening.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms could use a good cleaning.
review.locationRemarks: located right next to the highway, and bus stops! Muir woods is only a short distance away!

review.title: Quiet, clean, close to S.F.
review.reviewText: Perfect for our event in S.F. Didn't want to stay overnight in the city. This quiet place was a short, easy drive 30 minutes away.

review.title: Went hiking at Muir Woods, very close, very clean.
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, clean, comfortable room. Breakfast was very good!!

review.title: Close to town and nature
review.reviewText: We stayed two nights at this hotel. We really enjoyed it, especially the friendliness of the staff and the proximity to all our adventures. We thought the extras that this hotel offers (like free bikes, s'mores by the fire pit were awesome). Also Charlie at the reception was very helpful and friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, proximity to towns (Sausalito, Tiburon) and city (San Francisco) , hiking and biking, friendliness of the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: I think the rooms would stand to be renovated especially the bathrooms though.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Muir Woods, Tiburon, Sausalito, San Francisco. Great base for biking, hiking and exploring.

review.title: Nice Hotel

review.title: Good base for exploring San Francisco, Muir Woods
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Effort made by staff to provide treats like smores by the fire on the patio, nice pool. Breakfast is good but shame it all on plastic plates and cutlery.  Would return if in the area again. Room good size, nice that they all have patio doors or balconys.

review.title: Nice hotel- great amenities- friendly staff
review.reviewText:
I would definitely come back to this hotel! 
           Great amenities- clean gym- good breakfast- excellent staff! Great overall service from front desk to cleaning crew
Such a great experience! Very clean rooms very hospital. Overall a great experience I would

review.title: Great, friendly hotel.
review.reviewText:
Very friendly staff. Great little touches like cookies at reception and s'mores in the evening toasted on an open fire overlooking Mount Tamalpais. 

Pool and spa/hot-tub clean and quiet. Spa very hot!

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: Just north of San Francisco, perfect if your planning to make a drive to Napa. Breakfast was free and amazing! Free bike rentals and a beautiful trail near the water. Building is on the older side, floors were a little loud but they have done a great job at up keeping, they were putting new rugs in when we were there. Would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Excellent location

review.positiveRemarks: This hotel is just a few minutes from downtown San Francisco, but almost half the price of a downtown hotel. It has spacious and beautiful grounds.
review.negativeRemarks: The computers are very slow, but the printer is great.

review.title: Perfect location for my yearly visit to relatives

review.title: Easy access to SF

managementResponses.response:
On behalf of all of us at the Holiday Inn Express in Mill Valley, I would like to thank you for your visit, it was our pleasure to serve you, and we appreciate you taking time from your busy schedule and providing us with your input. 

Your feedback is extremely valuable to us and we are delighted to receive such a positive review.  Your comments are extremely important to us and I will definitely share them with our team.  Knowing that we accomplished our optimum goal of providing you with a good experience during your stay makes our job so rewarding.

Thank you again, we look forward to welcoming you back to the Bay Area, hopefully in the very near future.

Best regards

We had to cross the Golden Gate bridge which was an experience.  Staff  very helpful.

review.title: TravelingNorth

review.title: Convenient location- beautiful views

Nice helpful employees.
Rooms are outdated but they are going to start remodeling soon I was told...
Very good location
Nice place! We enjoy staying here when we have work projects in the city

Service excellent. Staff very friendly.
Complimentary breakfast variety was the best I've seen at most hotels. Hotel is dated, but clean.
Breakfast was fantastic.  Staff was friendly.  Location is great.

review.title: Convenient position
review.reviewText: Well placed hotel for San Francisco & Marin County. Good selection for buffet breakfast that kept you going for a while! Pleasant hotel  positioned right by the Mill Valley - Sausalito foot/bike path great for good walks.

review.title: comfortable hotel near SF
review.reviewText: Comfortable hotel near the Golden Gate Bridge in Mills Valley; quiet place with clean rooms; with Queen beds we were able to sleep there as a family of four; nice but basic American breakfast; easy parking and access; near the bridge which brings you in 20 minutes to downtown San Francisco.

review.title: good choice
review.reviewText: I was pleased with my stay. It was the perfect location to points in Marin and also to the city. We stayed our first two nights in the city and the noise  and activity level got to be too much. Marin was a haven!

review.title: Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is convenient, clean, large rooms, the Italian restaurant and bar next door is nice. The price is pretty high but this is an expensive part of California.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds are very comfy
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast is a bit dull.

review.title: DISAPPOINTED
review.reviewText:
When we arrived the Hotel it had a relaxed feel and the staff were nice. There was ample parking, the breakfast was good and the outdoor lounge area is great. 
However our room smelled of stale cigarette smoke and the hallway leading to the room was dark, dingy and smelled bad.
We paid for the room through a third party so the hotel should have only taken a holding deposit for room incidentals from our credit card. Unfortunately they made four unauthorized charges to our card totaling $1,051.00. We were near the end of a three week holiday and these charges left our travel card short of funds. I contacted the hotel twice and received an unconcerned reply saying it was a mistake and the funds would be reimbursed within 24 hours. well this did not happen. We had to use a credit card to complete the trip and are now about to incur fees to transfer the travel card balance back into Australian dollars.
review.positiveRemarks: There was ample parking, the breakfast was good and the outdoor lounge area is great
review.negativeRemarks: Repaint and carpet the hall then put some brighter lights in. Don't blow your customers off when you have stuffed up by over charging them.
review.locationRemarks: Sausalito and Muir Woods are very close

review.reviewText: Difficult check in proceedure. Room not available, was not accomodated even after a long wait well past 3pm check in and had reservations. Desk staff not great by a long shot.

review.negativeRemarks: lighting in bathroom insufficent; use larger bulbs

review.title: View of the Freeway underpass
review.reviewText: Ok, so it was a typical hotel room. But, if you have a temperpedic mates at home, then you will HATE their mattress. We were up half the night with back pain. The view was of the underpass and marshy water with a walking path. I would not have considered it a "view". The breakfast was amazing. The cinnamon rolls were exceptional. The front desk dude, when I asked about the toll bridges, made it sound like I would be breaking the law and get a ticket in the mail, but it was "no big deal, just tell them you're a tourist". He should have explained better. Overall, alright.

review.title: This hotel was a great surprise!

What I really enjoyed was the access to the bike path and the walking bridge over the marsh to several restraunts.  I had my own bike, but I noticed that bikes were available and free to check out for a couple of hours.  I also really enjoyed the complimentary s'more kit and the patio with the fire pit.  Such a nice idea!  I will definitely book a room again when I return to the area.

Great place to stay, front desk staff not very friendly or inviting but polite but that only negative! Awesome breakfast, great room, loved the s'mores, kids loved pool & was very comfortable accomodation.
old facilities, smelly hallway, noisy above, too expensive for what it is

review.title: Nice hotel with easy access to the highway.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very friendly. Loved the free breakfast (cinnamon rolls ... yum!) Allowed dogs so was able to travel with our chocolate lab (most hotels have a weight limit of 25 or 30 lbs).  Would stay again!
Courteous staff, clean rooms, comfortable bed, free wifi and decent breakfast, great location next to water and running path.  Gym is very small but adequate.

review.title: Nice hotel with excellent location in Mill Valley!
review.reviewText: Brought two dogs, so booked a special room (all 'special' rooms allowed for animals are on 1st floor).  Very clean room with promised amenities (coffee maker, mini-fridge) located near the parking lot and the path along the water (lots of runners and bicyclists).  Nice outdoor area attached to the room, as well (fenced).  Very efficient and friendly front desk staff, but noticed that other staff members are not so happy to be there.  I suspect that the high volume of clients at this well located hotel make for lots of work for the staff members.  OK breakfast, with eggs, toast, cinnamon rolls, biscuits, sausage, cereal, yogurt, orange juice, coffee.  I'd return again!
review.positiveRemarks: Location and walking path outside the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff members attitudes...yes, this does really matter to people who are traveling!

The location is great but it is difficult to get to and from if you are not familiar with the area.  I did use their business center for guests and that was a plus.  I would stay there again for sure.

The included breakfasts were really good.  For Mill Valley the room rate was very reasonable.
Overall I was completely satisfied.

review.title: Convenient but way overpriced! $500 for 2 nights!!
review.reviewText: Not a luxury hotel. Put in handicapped room (we're not handicapped) and we had made the reservations back in January. My tall husband could not see into the mirror, had to bend down to do so. We were on the ground floor and every time someone would enter from an exterior door it would resonate throughout the whole floor. I woke up several times during the night due to the door slamming.  Water draining from other rooms was quite loud in our bathroom...
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very friendly and helpful.

review.reviewText: The hotel was ok. Room was tiny, Internet was so slow is was unusable and they put me close to a generator that made noise all night.

review.title: Great pool, outdated carpets...
review.reviewText:
We stayed there in April, and still were able to enjoy the outdoor pool, which is the best thing of this Hotel.
We're overall statisfied : spacious rooms, convenient access to 101 yet not too much noise. However the carpets are pretty dirty and need to be changed. It gives a rundown impression to the hotel, when the overall comfort is still pretty good. Breakfast is the usual Holiday Inn express stuff. Not nice, but good enough and free.

In general, if you are with extra driving, you'll find a better deal in San Rafael.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Pool

review.title: Perfectly located hotel.
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel with everything you could need. Complimentary s'mores by the fire pit is a nice touch. We enjoyed our room backing onto the garden/pool area. Nice breakfast - staff opened another room when it got busy which was appreciated. We would stay again.

review.title: Nice place close to Muir Woods and Stinson Beach
review.reviewText:
We spent two nights at this hotel with our 5.5 year old and 4 year old.
The place was nice with a decent heated pool. The pool could have been a little warmer but once we started moving in it, it was ok. Breakfast was good, the usual for Holiday Inn Express with a little bit for everything (except non-dairy milk which would have been nice as our oldest is lactose intolerant).
There are several restaurants in walking distance.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is close to Muir Woods and Stinson Beach.

review.title: A beautiful and comfortable Home Away From Home
review.reviewText: Form the moment we arrived the staff was professional, friendly, and helpful. They are very accommodating and will try to honor any and all special needs or requests. We liked everyone, but were especially impressed with Marlene at the front desk (we kept calling her Melody and finally settled on 'Divine Miss M'). She was always calm, pleasant, and delightful to deal with. The location is spectacular:  an unobstructed view of Mt. Tamalpais and in the middle of expansive salt marshes abounding with all kinds of animal and bird life. It is like staying in the middle of a nature preserve!  There is a walking/biking path through the marshes that extends in both directions for miles. This is our second stay at the hotel and both times we were impressed with  the gorgeous setting and the clean and comfortable accommodations. The free breakfast is generous and fresh, with many hot and cold choices. The coffee is fantastic and available all day long. No need for Starbucks here!  The breakfast room is clean with beautiful views of the mountain and marshes. The staff are all efficient and friendly. The pool is heated year round and is very clean and the deck is large with many chairs, tables, pool towels, and a very hot, clean, marvelous jacuzzi. The beds are extremely comfortable; the pillows are large and deluxe. This is the best place to stay in Mill Valley and surroundings. It is clear this is a very well-managed facility. We can't wait to go back!
review.positiveRemarks: We like everything! No complaints at all. The location, the accommodations, the staff are all stellar! Extremely well maintained and managed property!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing at all.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is surrounded by breathtaking natural beauty. San Francisco is minutes away by bus or car. There is hiking, biking, and beaches nearby.

review.title: second time here!
review.reviewText: this is our second time staying at this hotel. When visiting San Francisco, I prefer to stay out of the city; stay away from traffic congestion and be closer to nature, and this hotel is in the perfect location.  It is only a 5 minute drive from the Golden Gate Bridge.  It's close to the freeway and makes travel to Northern California easy. The complementary breakfast is a BIG perk, saved us time and money.  The beds are very comfortable and I have NO complaints whatsoever. Highly recommended.
It was ok. Nothing special. Few cool things like s'mores and bike rentals. Average/small rooms
We spent the night here after visiting the muir woods, great location, great restaurants close by.
Too expensive and charged you for bottled water etc. that a person didn't know you had to pay for. Do not use restraunt next door very unfriendly. You pay 3 dollars for each half soda. No refils

review.title: Clean, comfortable, unexpected upscale feel.
review.reviewText: The room had relaxing colors and felt really clean. They had washable duvets that were bright white and felt freshly washed. The room is set up nicely and looks modern. The general hallways to access room could use some better lighting and new carpet but the lounge is very nice and inviting with fireplaces and comfy furniture. Cool pool area with awesome private lounge chairs. Would go back for sure very reasonable for the quality.

review.title: Dirty place to stay
review.reviewText:
I only survived 1.5 hours at this hotel. 

The smell of the building is terrible. The rooms are extremely tiny, you barely have space for luggage. The carpet in our room was torn at several places. And definitely the most disgusting thing was having to share the room with slugs. 

We asked to get another room and they did not have another one available. We had to move to another hotel at 1 am.

After our vacation was over I noticed a charge of 5.99 from this hotel. Called and they charged me for a bottle of water that I never had. Had to ask for reimbursement and the "manager" at that time was extremely rude.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing!
review.negativeRemarks: Everything and everybody needs improvement. From management to housekeeping!

review.title: Good choice - Worth the $$
review.reviewText: Nice Room, excellent Staff. The only down side was the city of Mill Valley itself. A very pretentious and ultra-liberal town that has that holier-than-thou attitude common to all liberal cities. I know I'm probably describing the entire bay area (and Seattle), but it's impossible not to see political correctness run amuck in the form of rainbow flags, Obama bumper stickers, and tofu-eating people in spandex. These are the same people that criticize those "rich Republicans" while they themselves live in these ridiculously expensive homes and drive their Prius vehicles. I guess they think they justify their obvious hypocrisy because they bring their own bags when they shop and they adopt babies from other countries instead of adopting American children that need parents here at home. Nice hotel room though!

review.title: FANTASTIC
review.reviewText: It was truly a home away from home. The staff treated us like old friends. We were exceedingly comfortable -- the pillows were especially awesome. Our room looked out at the bay. Love the location of the hotel, as well. My partner and I grew up in Marin, so we are very familiar with the surroundings and other options. We are looking forward to coming back again, staying longer, and bringing our dogs with us next time. Thanks so much, Holiday Inn Express, and Expedia for helping us out!

review.title: Perfect Location - Perfect Stay
review.reviewText: The Holiday Inn Express in Mill Valley was a perfect place for me & my husband to stay while visiting San Francisco. You definitely would need to have a car to stay outside the city, but to us it was not worth paying an extra $30+/day for our car to stay in the city. We had planned to go to Muir Woods, the Marin Headlands and to Sonoma so we thought this area would be a great central location. Mill Valley is just north of the Golden Gate bridge and a mile or so from Sausilito. We ate in Sausilito twice because it was so easy to access and the food was awesome. The free breakfast at the hotel was fabulous every morning - anything you would need to get your day started. They keep the place immaculate - always super clean. The bike/walking trail around the hotel was a nice change of pace after running up & down the streets of SF. They have a nice pool & hot tub. We took advantage of the hot tub one night after a long day hiking. We are sticklers on how comfortable a mattress feels at a hotel! This bed did not disappoint. We split our stay for the week with the Holiday Inn & a place in wine country. Wish we would have stayed the entire week at the HI Exp and just drove to wine country for the day. Would definitely stay there again! LOVED IT!

review.title: Walking path.
review.reviewText: Great walking path go mkles in either direction from hotel.

review.title: Nice Hotel for a short weekend get away
review.reviewText:
Nice Hotel, morning breakfast was great. Trying to find some place for lunch and dinner can be a pain!!
Took the shuttle to Muir Woods National Park, (shuttle bus was a few minutes walk down the path).
Overall nice hotel, decent staff, and even got to experience the earthquake lol
I enjoyed this hotel!! Great location for the price in my opinion !! Would definitely stay here again if coming back to the Bay Area

review.title: Great value and amenities close to SF
review.reviewText: So many hotels we researched in the San Francisco area were very expensive with costly parking and did not include breakfast. This Holiday Inn was a good compromise and just across the Golden Gate Bridge from the attractions and close to Sausalito. The staff was friendly and helpful and while the hotel was a bit dated, it was clean and in good repair with nice grounds and modern furnishings in the room. We enjoyed the pool, hot tub and free bike rentals as well as the complimentary daily hot breakfast. They even kept a small fire going in the outdoor patio with s'mores available. It is adjacent to a nice authentic and classy Italian restaurant that was a bit pricey but worth it.

review.title: Close to San Fran
review.reviewText:
Pros - close to San Fran, Muir Woods and beach.  Hotel offered pool, s'mores, and bikes 

Cons - rooms outdated, hot tub was broke
great location. loved the complementary bikes. pool was great. breakfast good.

This hotel is a little far from Fisherman's Wharf and Chinatown, but if you don't mind the drive it's definitely a nice place to stay. You can ride the Golden Gate bus into the Wharf area, but the bus stop to get back to the hotel requires a cab ride unless you're up for a long walk.

review.title: Lovely hotel close to Sausalito
review.reviewText: We loved it here- very helpful staff on reception and a varied breakfast choice. Lovely walks and bike rides into Sausalito. Great swimming pool and hot tub. Our room was large and comfortable for us 3 but  could easily take 4people.

review.title: Nice.
review.reviewText: It served our purpose.  We enjoyed the proximity to the things we were doing.  The card keys caused us a lot of grief.  Twice we had to have new ones made to get into our room.  The staff was very pleasant and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Especially liked the S'mores at night.  We thought the breakfast was better than a lot of the hotel breakfasts.
review.negativeRemarks: The card keys rarely worked after the first insert.  The handles on the sliding doors and exterior were hard to use, broke my nail.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for going to Frisco, Sausalito or the mountains.

review.title: Great Hotel in Mill Valley

review.positiveRemarks: Location - in between Salsalito & Tiburon
review.negativeRemarks: Great stay will come back.
review.locationRemarks: Running tracks close by, 5 minutes drive from Salsalito where great restaurants & shops can be found. Less busy than San Francisco city

review.title: Good hotel, centrally located
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel on a recent visit to San Francisco, Marin Headlands and Point Reyes.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The free breakfast was handy too!
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the free breakfast were great.  We also liked the pool.
review.negativeRemarks: Real eggs at breakfast.

review.title: Great Location out of the city
review.reviewText: Hotel was a little older but had been updated nicely.  The room was clean and comfortable with plenty of room.  Decorating was updated and very nice.  Breakfast was very good....better than typical continental breakfast.  Nice walking path behind the hotel, and I understand they have bikes available for guests but unfortunately we were not there long enough to take advantage of that.  Ferry terminal is not too far away so you can easily cross over the bay to San Francisco and not have to worry about driving or parking over there.  Would stay again and will recommend to friends and family.

review.title: Quiet but close to the City
review.reviewText: We traveled with our children and small pet dog.  The hotel was close to a path that you could bike or walk to the city on.  There is a fabulous Italian restaurant on site.  We were located off Hwy 1 just north of the San Francisco.  We drove across the Golden Gate Bridge and also took the bypass highway during our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was nice and large.  They have smore's on the patio firepit in the evenings.  We were too busy to use the pool but it looked nice.
review.locationRemarks: Drive or Bike into San Francisco.  See Alcatraz, the Golden Gate bridge and drive down the crookedest street ever.  Eat chowder at Fisherman's Wharf,

review.title: Close to SF without the exorbitant prices.
review.reviewText:
My wife and I stayed here one night as part of a trip for our wedding anniversary. We only live an hour away but wanted something close to San Francisco where we were having dinner without paying the obnoxious prices for a nice San Francisco hotel. We stayed in this hotel a few years ago when it was under different ownership and really enjoyed it then. Luckily, it hasn't changed much. The rooms are still clean, updated, and comfortable. The king bed was really comfortable, and the bathroom amenities were nice (Bath & Body Works). There is a large flat screen TV in the room with HD channels. It's a huge pet peeve of mine when hotels have large flat screen TVs with a standard definition feed, so that was good.

The included breakfast was pretty good. You get the standard fare (cereal, bagels, juice), as well as a good selection of hot foods (eggs, sausage, hot cinnamon rolls, pancake maker). We saw that they offer free smores around dinner time, but we didn't have the opportunity to try as we were out for dinner.

All in all, if you're looking for a clean and comfortable hotel without paying sky-high hotel prices in San Francisco for a comparable level of comfort, I would highly recommend this place. It's also got some nice views of water from the hotel grounds. Note that if your room is facing northeast, you're probably going to be looking at the underside of Highway 101. I'd ask for a northwest-facing 2nd floor room for the best water views.
review.positiveRemarks: They offer free bike rentals to use on nearby bike paths which are on the water.
review.negativeRemarks: No real complaints.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Sausalito which has a variety of shops and restaurants. You can also take a ferry from Sausalito into SF if you don't want to bother driving.

review.title: hotel staff very inattentive
review.reviewText: given wrong room at check in because they didn't bother to read my reservation, did not accept a fedex package I had sent causing me problems with my business. Answered the phone by asking " what do you want ? " very rude indeed!
review.positiveRemarks: location
review.negativeRemarks: change the entire front desk staff

review.title: Great location, nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Great location, nice hotel. Close to the action, but far enough away that you don't feel like you're boxed into the concrete jungle. Friendly staff, nice room. Reasonably priced for the area.

review.title: Pet tolerant, not pet friendly...
review.reviewText:
We made reservations over the phone with Expedia and got a good rate of $150. The Expedia agent and I discussed that I was travelling with my dogs and the agent assured me that there were no charges and no problems because the hotel was "pet friendly."

Upon arrival, we learned that the hotel charges $75 per night (half again the room rate) for pets and of course only certain rooms were pet allowed. There was no specified dog walk area (i.e. La Quinta). Because the reservation from Expedia did not mention the dogs, I think the clerk was ready to turn us away, but the room was already paid for. So she had no choice but to take us and I had no choice but to stay since the reservation was non-refundable. Fortunately, it was only one night. So be careful when making reservations through Expedia and don't bother with this place if you have pets with you.

The room was nice and quiet. Location was lovely despite the highway overhead. So okay otherwise.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable room
review.negativeRemarks: Service, pet policy clarified
review.locationRemarks: Easy on and off Highway 101; location has good and bad: beautiful estuary with walking trail but highway overhead.

review.title: Beautiful location,very close to S.F. Bay Bridge.

The breakfasts were equipped with all the goodies,eggs,bacon,sausage,biscuits,fruits,rolls,muffins.bagels,cereals(4),milk, juices,coffee,etc. The outside fireplace in the evening was a nice touch and the smores were great. There is a walking and biking path just steps from the motel right by the water.Parking is free. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great for kids!
review.reviewText: My kids loved this place. The location is great close to SF. They offered complimentary s'mores for the kids which they loved. All in all great hotel!

review.title: Nice hotel. Close to Muir Woods.
review.reviewText: Nice, clean and quiet. Slept well with the comfortable bed. Continental breakfast was good and convenient.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText:
We spent two nights here while visiting the Marin Headlands and Muir Woods. It has a great location that is easy to find and access. The room had been updated, as had the entire hotel and was very attractive. We were afraid that our room on the ground floor was going to very noisy, but it wasn't at all. They were completely full when we were there so the breakfast area was packed, but they opened up an additional room and breakfast was very adequate.

The Italian restaurant next door was excellent, we ended up eating there two nights in a row and enjoyed it. There was also a good restaurant close by on the path that went by the hotel by the water. We walked there for lunch and it was good also.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location and helpful staff.

review.title: Staying at Holiday Inn Express a pleasure
review.reviewText: It was a treat to stay at the Holiday Inn Express in Mill Valley, CA. The rooms were clean and comfortable and quiet. The staff was friendly and helpful. The pool was great and we enjoyed the S'mores party in the evening over the fire pit.

review.reviewText: Good breakfast. More low fast options please. Friendly staff. But the hallway on our floor (room 226) was musty smelling. Needs new carpets to get ride of the smell. Rooms were ok.

review.title: Best for the price in the Sausilito Area
review.reviewText: This hotel is a short drive from the beautiful Sausilito. My room was large and I paid a very small amount to get my room up graded which gave me a small patio. The gym facility was larger than some and had multiple machines. The breakfast was nothing to write home about but you cant complain when it comes free with your stay. Bed was comfy, big screen cable tv, and very convenient to the 101. Best hotel in this area for the price.

review.title: Highly Recomended
review.reviewText: After a full day of driving we were so pleased to have chosen this hotel. Excellently located, friendly staff, larger, comfortable rooms, free wifi, hot breakfast, good value. What's not to like?
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms are particularly comfortable for the price.

We do hope to see you again soon.

review.title: Good location, easy driving distance to SF
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, clean and spacious room. Easy on/off Hwy. 101 into and out of SF but unfortunately not a lot of restaurants within the vicinity. However, Buckeye Roadhouse, is outstanding. Ask for directions if your not familiar with the area.
review.positiveRemarks: The cost and location.
review.negativeRemarks: While breakfast offered a good choice of food, some of the food was less than appetizing (e.g., eggs, pancakes).
review.locationRemarks: Easy drive to Muir Woods, Mt. Tam., Pt. Reyes.

review.title: Fine Base Camp to the San Francisco Bay Area
review.reviewText: We came up to spend the long Valentines weekend. From our hotel room we had a nice view of the inlet from Richardson Bay during mostly low tide, with lots of feeding birds. We were short drives from a variety of nice local restaurants. San Francisco is less than 1/2-hour away, either by car or by scenic ferry ride from nearby Sausalito. Well-stocked grocery stores are nearby if you need them. With a little more time, we could have walked the nearby trails -- or biked them. I'm sure this would have been pleasant. The hotel does advertise free access to bicycles, but the ones available were too big for us Hobbits. Next time we might bring our own. This and the non-heat-lamp (see below) were our only complaints keeping our rating from being an Excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice view from our balcony; near a variety of nice local restaurants; less than 1/2-hour from San Francisco by car or ferry; good value for the price
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom "heat lamp" fixture only had a regular CFL bulb -- "shedding more heat than light" would have been better; bike access good, selection poor.
review.locationRemarks: Nice view of the inlet from Richardson Bay during mostly low tide, with lots of feeding birds; close to a variety of nice local restaurants

review.title: Z
review.reviewText: Great facility, nice staff, wonderful location. Only problem I had was my key didn't open the door., so I had to have a maintenance worker help me. After 6 attempts it worked.

review.title: Damp and smell
review.reviewText: The Hotel is very old building with new furnitures in the room... the local weather is high humidity ....but I have to say the hotel is very damp and smells...

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: We stayed here in mid-October. Has a nice walkway around the marsh, which was nice for an evening walk. We stayed here to be close to Muir woods. Luckily the government re-opened and we got in on our last day (AWESOME). The rooms were comfortable and clean. Read some reviews of being isolated. It is a little. But if you turn right at the entrance and keep to the right side you will get into town. A 5 minute drive around the marsh. You will get into the main town where there are plenty of places to eat. Found local hamburger joint. Best hamburgers ever (ate there twice in the 3 days we stayed there).Short drive to the coast for a sunset(about 20 minutes).

review.title: More than your average Holiday Inn Express
review.reviewText: This place is a gem. We were welcomed with a s'more pack to enjoy at the fire pit…offered loaner bicycles to enjoy the bike path around the water…everything in the hotel was clean and very well appointed. We'll definitely stay here again. It is close to good food, long walks by the water, and Muir Woods.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent staff interaction, the s'more packs. Location on the water.
review.locationRemarks: Muir Woods!

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable, well appointed. 5 stars.

review.title: Wonderful stay
review.reviewText: This hotel stay was wonderful. The room was very clean and the bed was very very comfortable. The breakfast was tasty and filling. Easy access from the highway and beautiful scenic drive into San Francisco. Definitely recommended.

review.title: 5 star experience
review.reviewText: wonderful location, friendly staff, beautiful facilities, right next to bike/running path along the bay, bikes for loan, very quiet.

review.title: Nice hotel North of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice location. 5 minutes drive from Saulsalito and 15 to 20 minutes drive to San Francisco harbor sites (except during rush hour). There is a nature preserved area behind the hotel with a bicycle path or walking path. Breakfast is about average but given the price and the location we did not mind it. Visit downtown Mill Valley, a cute little town with plenty of restaurant, stores sand a movie theater. Go to Saulsalito only once if you have not been there before. Very touristy, the restaurants charge 1.5 times more than in other areas and their police can harass you at night if you are coming out one of the restaurants/bars ( I was stopped and given a sobriety test which of course I passed because all I had was a diet drink but I did not like being stopped). The hotel is clean and for the price it is a good deal.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, price, cleanliness.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: walking path though nature preserve area behind the hotel, 15 minutes drive to Muir Woods from the hotel and other sites including San Francisco sites

review.title: Nice Stay
review.reviewText: This was a very nice stop on our way home from South San Francisco. We especially enjoyed having biking, running and walking trails immediately available from the motel.
review.locationRemarks: The bike trails can be accessed from the motel and seem to follow the beautiful SF Bay for great distances. There were also many runners and walkers.

review.title: That wonderful mildew smell.
review.reviewText: The hotel looks promising at first glance. After we checked in, we were walking to our room and realized the hotel smells of mildew. when we saw how close it is to Richardson Bay, literally right up to the hotel's edge, we knew it was from water seeping around and under the hotel. Since it is an older renovated hotel, I knew it had gone through many flooding experiences. The rooms are clean. Bathroom large. It was New Year's eve night and asked the desk clerk for 2 glasses to have some champaign and they were not willing to accommodate us which I thought was something they could have done easily. They do not go out of their way to please you. Breakfast was good however we got there at 9 am and it was very crowded. There is a nice swimming pool. If mildew smell is something you really don't like, I would look for another place to stay.
The staff was great. We enjoyed the walking and biking paths, and the breakfast were good.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, paths and breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms.
review.locationRemarks: The location was good

review.title: Nice hotel close to MUIR woods
review.reviewText: The stay at the hotel was pretty comfortable. There are restaurants and shops close by. No elevators if you stay in the first floor. The hotel was marked as non-smoking. But, there were signs on the property which stated that the property may have chemicals (or smoke).
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Close to MUIR woods.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel is very nice. Obviously an older place that had been recently renovated. The Heating/ Cooling system is a little old. There is On/ OFF... and thats about it. So you turn the heat on "low" you wake up in the middle of the night in a sweat lodge. Need to update that with a thermostat or something. Other than that had a great stay. i mean for goodness sakes they have FREE S'MORES!!! From 7-10pm they hand out sticks, chocolate marshmallows and graham crackers. Brilliant move. for a grand total of .48 cents I will be telling people about that hotel for years to come. And I would absolutely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Free Smores!
review.negativeRemarks: The heating/ air conditioning system
Breakfast area too small always full. Overflow area uninviting - too big. Supervision - to make sure every room is cleaned every day

review.title: Nice hotel close to Golden Gate, Muir Woods, etc.
review.reviewText:
This hotel is in a very good location for visiting the Golden Gate area, Muir Woods, Point Reyes etc. by car. We loved these attractions. A GPS is really useful here since some of the routes are confusing. It's a good base of operations.

The hotel location is not good for walking to anything. There is an attached restaurant (that we didn't try), but any other restaurants require a drive, though some are not too far away. The Soul Cafe is one of the closer restaurants and is very good for wholesome food, with a good vegetarian selection, but is not a fancy place. The breakfast provided at the hotel is good.

WiFi and parking are included.
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet rooms, well equipped.
review.negativeRemarks: The door on our first room did not work properly so we changed rooms. Some of the rooms need minor repairs.
review.locationRemarks: Remember that it costs $6 to cross the Golden Gate Bridge going into the city (buy your pass online before crossing), but is free to cross it leaving.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText:
We've stayed at this hotel for years even before they changed ownership. The location is superb, being right off the freeway and so close to so many things. It's situated in a beautiful nature preserve with birds and biking/walking trails right off the property. It's absolutely beautiful. We come to this part of the Bay Area to get into nature. This is where we stay. If you want to go into the city of SF, it's a couple of exits away. It's close to Sausalito, Mill Valley, Mt. Tam, etc.

Also, the beds and pillows here are really comfortable. You should sleep well here. It's a small, quaint hotel with a great pool and spa area. The complimentary breakfast isn't great but their options will please someone in your family or travel group. Free Wi-Fi!!! I can't tell you how annoying it is to pay for internet service when you travel. Here, you won't.

Absolutely beautiful area with lots to eat nearby. Forgot to mention there's great shopping in Corte Madera (just a couple of exits away) if you don't want to go into the city. It's a lot less crowded. They have a Container Store. Enough said.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfy beds and pillows Free wi-fi
review.negativeRemarks: could incorporate some local organic breads, fruits and coffee for the breakfast spread. That would add a nice touch.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: We were very disappointed with this hotel. On arrival, receptionist was friendly and helpful but this was the only plus. Staff were not very well informed following morning when we asked about tips for the area. Room was spacious but not clean - skirting boards filthy. Breakfast was a disaster - everything in paper cups, bowls etc., but we found this to be quite the norm in US. Even worse were dirty tables while staff member stood around with nothing to do. Staff at breakfast couldn't even greet people with good morning.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was o.k. - close to motorway and Sausalito but other than that, we would not recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Sausalito, Motorway and Ferry port to San Francisco

review.title: The best motel of our trip.
review.reviewText:
Easily the best motel we stayed at in three months in the US and Canada. We loved the location near the bay, with a wetland opposite. We used the free bikes to ride the trail network and discover Sausalito. The breakfast area was first class and the rooms with their two basins, desk and chairs and outside courtyard were very functional and comfortable. The pool and spa were also great.

The staff were a delight and made us feel welcome throughout our short stay. This may sound like a paid advertisement, but actually we just wanted a place to stay for one night and got lucky. We really couldn't fault a thing.
review.positiveRemarks: The exceptional quality of the hotel facilities, the friendly and knowledgable counter staff and unexpected extras like bikes.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing really, but a minor improvement would be a microwave in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Bike track to Sausalito, coffee shops and Marin headlands, with Muir woods redwood forest.

review.title: Minimal amenities
review.reviewText: This is the first hotel that I have stayed in in a great while that did not have a hair dryer. Staff was very friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice view. Right near the beach.
review.negativeRemarks: General condition was a little run down and message of the entrance that said that the property may contain items that could cause health problems.
review.locationRemarks: Great for walks along the water on the boardwalk and bicycle path.

review.title: Close to Sausalito

Rooms are spacious and well appointed and the breakfast service has plenty of choices. Really like the outdoor seating area with the fire pit for mornings and evenings. The pool is a good size the furniture and decor substantial which makes the ambiance even better. There are even beautiful hammocks tucked under the shade trees to relax.

review.title: Good spot for tours of SF and Napa
review.reviewText:
The approach underwhelms, because the turn in/turn out is difficult and the entrance is unprepossessing. But the good thing is that it only gets better thereafter. Rooms are comfortable and quiet -- the latter a surprise because of the proximity of the highway. They are not five star but they are perfectly serviceable. Same thing about the breakfast. The pool is a nice asset and the hot tub a real plus. (I did not try the gym.) Another nice feature is the free bicycles, giving access to lots of interesting trails right alongside the hotel. Staff friendly and helpful. The location is excellent because of the highway, easy access to Tiburon, Sausalito, Mill Valley and Mt Tamalpais (the latter definitely worth the trip), as well as SF and Napa.
Good value for the money and a good base for touring.

review.title: Great Location!!!!
review.reviewText:
In trying to find a hotel in the SF area, I looked for three things:
1) Free parking
2) Free breakfast
3) Free wifi

We found all of these things and more! The breakfast was tasty, with anything you could desire (eggs, bacon, muffins, bagels, pancakes, yogurt, cold cereal, fruit, etc.

From 4-7pm, delicious chocolate chip cookies are in the lobby along with fruit infused water. From 7-10pm the front desk gives out s'mores packets that you take and make over at their outdoor fire pit off the lobby.

As a bonus, there is an outdoor heated saltwater pool, and a large spa. Water temps were perfect and we enjoyed each night.

Wifi was strong and very easy to access. Would definitely come back and would recommend to others. Booking a head of time can also save a lot of $$ too.

review.title: Excellent location, friendly staff, good value
review.reviewText: A real 'find' for Marin County---very near the freeway (without freeway sounds) as well as only a few exits before the entrance to the Golden Gate Bridge. Located on the Shoreline Highway leading to Muir Woods and Stinson Beach. An excellent Northern Italian restaurant right next door, which doesn't look like much from the outside, but has a beautiful interior, and features many homemade basics---pasta, bread, etc.---along with a very good California wine list. The hotel facility itself has been refurbished, with added amenities like a heated tile floor in the bathroom; good shower, pleasant room accessories, and comfortable beds, etc. Your hotel fee includes a continental breakfast every morning from 6:30 to 9 AM---in a rather crowded little dining area, but the selections are serviceable, if not great. The one real downside is that the audibility of upstairs guests is greater than one would like, just because it is a fairly old building. There are good workout facilities, an indoor pool, and an outdoor fire pit. The hotel also has the unique offering of bicycle rentals, with a connecting bike path, and maps to other bicycle paths in the vicinity. The hotel was at full capacity all four nights I was there (Tues. through Fri. summer nights), which speaks well for the facility.
review.positiveRemarks: Ideal location for getting around Marin County and into the City; friendly service and well thought out amenities; an excellent restaurant next door.
review.negativeRemarks: Sound insulation between floors; size of dining area for breakfast.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: A nice hotel with a great location. Easy to get on the Golden Gate Bridge and into San Francisco, or head the other way to Muir Woods and Sausalito. The hotel has a somewhat modern, almost boutique look. It was very clean. The s'mores and outside fire pit are great. We did not use them, but it is a cool feature to have bikes to borrow. My only complaint would be some of the staff. I found a couple of them to be less than friendly. We also received a phone call from the front desk at 9:00 pm asking us to be quiet. We did not understand, since we were all in bed watching the Olympics. That night, and others, we could hear other people talking, being loud, and slamming doors. So maybe they need to add some sound proofing, or improve on making sure they get the right people when things get loud. Other than some noise and some staff, it was a great hotel.

review.title: Close To Everything
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a great location and when you consider you do not have to pay for parking as you would in the city it is a deal. The hotel has been remodeled but face it, it still is an old hotel with new carpet. It has the funky cottage cheese ceilings but we did find it quiet, clean, and it smelled new. The staff were exceptional and went out of their way to help on any questions.

The breakfast is nothing to write home about but is functional. There is a glass walled patio area for eating outside with a fire pit where you can eat breakfast or heat your smores at night. The pool out back is also great for the kids.

It is only fifteen minutes back into SF or five to ten to Sausalito. There is also a great running/biking path out the back.

Parking spaces at night are limited and getting across traffic as you exit in the morning can be a real bear if you need to get on Hwy 101 but the convenience of being so centrally located is a real win. We will visit again.

review.title: Pleasantly Surprised!
review.reviewText: We were pleasantly surprised with the hotel. This hotel meet our expectations. Website pictures and description were honest. In our other traveling experiences, we have found that it is often a gamble to fully trust website descriptions and pictures. But this time however, we felt very pleased with our decision to stay at Larkspur. While this hotel is small, it meet our need for a safe, clean, economical, and convenient stop during our visit to the Golden Gate Recreation area.
review.positiveRemarks: Opportunity to make S'mores by the fire pit after a long day of hiking and exploring made for a pleasant way to end the evening with family.
review.locationRemarks: Location was ideal for our one night stop during our visit to the Golden Gate Recreation area.

review.title: Complimentary bikes!
review.reviewText:
The most pleasing thing is that they offer complimentary bikes for 2 hours. There are three bike trails: one is right off the hotel, short, along the bay, very nice to ride in the morning. The second is to Sausalito, a little longer. Ride to Sausalito before the sunset, go to the bar/ restaurant and return back when it is almost dark. It takes more than 2 hours, but the staff is OK with it, because there are not many others, who wants to ride at night.
The third trail is to Tuburon. It is the longest one, takes a little more than 2 hours, especially, if you stop there for a cup of coffee. We called the hotel to tell that we were late on schedule. They responded that it would be OK, if we did not take TOO long, since others might wanted to ride bikes too. Nice of them!
When selecting bikes, Make sure that you can adjust the height of the seat ( some bikes were missing the lever). No bike racks ( for cars) are available though.
Breakfast was so-so. Bathroom was OK. I loved the moisturizer!
Location is perfect, if you are planning to bike around Sausalito-Tiburon, hike Muir Woods and drive to Stinson Beach (to watch sharks, haha).
Adjacent to the hotel is a contemporary Italian restaurant. Delicious! It also has a cool huge press to make an oil from CA olives ( a guy from Italy comes to make oil from October through December). The restaurant serves its own olive oil. Makes the memories unforgettable.
review.positiveRemarks: All complimentary: bikes, marshmallows (you can make them in an outdoor fire pit) and night drinks!
review.locationRemarks: Location is perfect, if you are planning to bike around Sausalito-Tiburon, hike Muir Woods and drive to Stinson Beach (to watch sharks, haha).
