review.title: Excellent highly recommended, "Green"?
review.reviewText:
Excellent and welcoming hotel. Location is suprisingly pleasant compared the the impression you get from Google Street view.

Rooms very well presented and clean, staff very pleasant and welcoming.

Best bits are S'mores in evening and the pool.

Slight disappointment is a perenial in the American Hotel industry, the use of disposable plates, cups and cutlery at breakfast is terrible for an otherwise "Green" hotel. Suggest management team take a visit to Monterey Aquarium, review policy and buy some plates and a sink!!
review.positiveRemarks: Pool.
review.negativeRemarks: Disposable breakfast ware.
review.locationRemarks: Easy clycling distance of GG Bridge, good public transport and great places to eat all around. Plenty bird life if you are a bird watcher.

review.title: A little Gem
review.reviewText: A perfect little gem tucked an easy drive away from San Fran. Besides the great rooms the pool was impeccably clean and as an added bonus they had bikes to borrow for free! Enjoyed a great bike ride on the trail that backs up to the hotels property. Would highly recommend this place!

review.title: Good place for a quick overnight to recharge.
review.reviewText: A pleasant setting with just enough amenities to make a quick overnight a pleasure. Check in was seamless, the room was clean and there are plenty of spots to sit and read by the indoor or outdoor fire places. Great high def tv in the room and bed was comfy. The only two complaints, which are minor are the vending machines (took my money) and the noisy bathroom fans.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Vending machines took my money.
review.locationRemarks: Very accessible to the 101 and a great location if you are spending time in Mill Valley.

review.title: Pleasant Surprise!
review.reviewText: Wonderful location. Enjoyed the nature habitat and view from our balcony. Pool was heated and my family enjoyed using it. Great coffee and nice breakfast. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Late checkout time gave us plenty of time to enjoy a great breakfast ande one more dip in the pool before we left. Very pleased. Everything we needed for our stay and lots of pleasant surprises.
review.positiveRemarks: Pool, Organic coffee. Great location, comfortable beds. Late checkout. Nice breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: Mill Valley is a beautiful community. Nice places to eat. Lots to do. Beautiful place to explore the outdoors.

review.title: barely OK
review.reviewText: very surface level upgrades and remnants of older unimproved areas - such as bath grout and tile etc..

review.title: Family traveling with two young children
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean. The beds were very comfortable, along with getting 4 pillows on each queen bed. The sheets were clean, no stains, and smelled fresh. The bathroom was very clean, no stains in or around the toilet. The seat looked to be new. The bathtub was real tile with clean grout and no stains. Our room had a flat screen tv (32in?), a dvd player (huge plus with kids), a refridgerator (it was a mini that was hidden in the entertainment center/dresser). Next to the desk was a power port that had extra plugs, usb, and other attachments. We went in February when the temp was around 55, we still went swimming! The kids loved it! The water in the pool was warm and crystal clear! They even had a hot tub that was just as clean and nice and warm. There were always towels. We never seen an over flowing trash can, or anything to make us think it was dirty. The hotel is @ 5 miles from the Golden Gate Bridge, and there is a paved trail right behind the hotel. Great for bike riders or walkers. It was in a nice part of town. There were restaurants close by, and a Walgreens a quarter of a mile down the road. The breakfast was simple but very nice. They had oatmeal, breads, milk, oj, yogurt, fresh fruits, string cheese, and dry cereal. Breakfast was from 6:30-9:30 (nice extended hours) and we didnt have to check out till 11 am (not so rushed). The patios are nice as well. We did not hear our neighbors either. If we go to San Fran again we will likely stay here, wonderful hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The heated pool and hot tub! The breakfast. The people were very polite but the only time I had to speak with them was at check in and check out.
review.negativeRemarks: I wish we could have gotten a microwave, but one is available by the breakfast area. That is the worst thing I can think of....
review.locationRemarks: There is a subway and Walgreens less than a mile from. As well as many dine in places just alittle farther away. And close to the Muir Woods :)

review.title: Great Value in Marin
review.reviewText:
The staff was helpful and friendly
The little freebies are wonderful (free continental breakfast - awesome selection! free bike rentals, smores kit, hiking fanny packs)
Great location - close to Sausalito and right on a great walking/biking trail
My only complaints are: comfort of the bed (too soft for my personal taste) and noise (could hear people talking when walking by in the hall).

I worked around the noise issue by turning on the heater fan in the room, which helped! I would love to go back to try the heated pool. I hope they have harder mattresses in other rooms!
review.positiveRemarks: Wonderful freebies including a great continental breakfast, free bike rentals, free smores kits and free hiking fanny packs
review.negativeRemarks: Bed was a little too soft for my taste
review.locationRemarks: Close to Sausalito and right next to bike trails

review.title: What an Extraordinary Staff!
review.reviewText: I had such an extraordinary experience at the Larkspur Hotel in Mill Valley. I would have to say in all my days of traveling I have never been around such wonderful, respectful and quick to please staff. I am beyond words with how well I was treated after a breakdown that was clearly my fault, they handled the situation so wonderfully. I would come back here to stay anytime and will recommend this hotel to everyone traveling to Marin. Thank you Larkspur Hotel!

review.title: Above and Beyond!
review.reviewText: I thought that this hotel was very nice! The amenities were free and beyond other hotels that I have stayed at. Very nice decor! Comfortable bed and the location was perfect. Right in the middle of everything and very close to the City of San Francisco. I live in Napa not far from there and would go again just for a weekend getaway! Loved it!
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was so comfortable! The amenities were beyond some of the other hotels that I've stayed at! Very nice!
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location! Right in the middle of everything!

review.title: nice hotel for short stays.
review.reviewText: nice hotel for short stays. close to a good italian restaurent, but thats the only option around

review.title: An OK hotel in a convenient location
review.reviewText:
It depends what you're looking for here. I needed a place to sleep prior to a class I was taking in the area the next day. I mostly wanted a clean room with comfortable bed in a convenient location. I absolutely got that. The bed was comfortable and the linens were very nice. The bathroom products were nice too.

Mostly the hotel is OK, but it's not a destination in and of itself. It's clearly an old hotel that has been renovated. The hallways still seem old and out of date, and my room at least had a popcorn ceiling. Heat and A/C in a unit by the window. The fan on that was loud, as is typical.

It is located on the bay and right on a really nice trail. And they do have bikes for guests to use. If you're in town to enjoy the area, and just want a comfortable place to sleep, this is a nice place to be.

review.title: What don't they have?!?
review.reviewText:
This hotel came up when we were searching for a place near Muir Woods, that accepts pets. Never heard of it, but the pictures looked nice. Man, this place is so cozy. If you are going for Nature, this is the place to stay. They have bikes to rent, hiking kits to borrow, outdoor fire to hang out and make smores... all of those FREE (well, included in the cost of the room). Not to mention free elixirs, healthy breakfast, heated pools, free DVD rentals.... I'm probably forgetting something.

There are nature trails, all very close. Muir Woods was our destination, my wife for the Nature, and me for the Grilled Cheese Sandwich w/ Tomato Bisque in the Gift Shop. I was impressed with both.

Will definitely visit this hotel again!

review.title: Convenient for San Francisco
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was good. I thought that improvements could be made in relation to the breakfast. Paper plates - not great!

review.title: Great stay/Great value
review.reviewText: Easy, convenient and clean.

review.title: Acceptable
review.reviewText: The hotel was comfortable and clean. Breakfast was the usual cereal, toast, yogurt, etc. The lobby, breakfast room, and outdoor patio were very nice. The hotel is located by a bike path and offers some beautiful mountain views. It is very close to the highway at the same time, but we were not disturbed by road noise. The pool area looked nice, but it was too chilly for use in mid-October. The room was a standard hotel room that had been spruced up with a large TV and some decent bed linens. Our tiny balcony was not an inviting place to sit due to its size. You can probably do better for the money.

review.title: Close to Sausilito and the houseboats
review.reviewText:
Loved the spaciousness of our room and the very comfy beds. Heated floors in the bathroom was nice on the tootsies. The Italian restaurant next door had the most devine food and wine with excellent service.
The had great fire pits to roast complimentary marshmellows and is located a short drive from the houseboats, Sausilito and the Golden Gate bridge. You could easily get to the Muir woods from here. But word of warning. If you are using a TomTom be careful as it will direct you up a very remote mountain so put in the exact address.

review.title: Great hotel with the added touches
review.reviewText: The Larkspur Hotel Mill Valley Hotel provided clean, comfortable rooms but it was the added extras that stood out for our family. The person on the front desk when we arrived was not only very friendly and welcoming, but extremely knowledgeable about what to see and do in the local area. The free bike hire and location right next to bike tracks was great, as was the free family S'mores kits and welcome drink. The swimming pool and spa were also very clean and large enough to have a decent swim in. Although the hotel is located near a freeway and our room was backing onto this area, we were not disturbed by any noise. We were very impressed by the hotel.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: This hotel positions itself as a boutique or upscale hotel, but is not worthy of either designation.

review.title: Not as good as advertised
review.reviewText:
I needed to stay in the Mill Valley area for business and did an extensive search for a nice hotel. Many reviews and the photos made this hotel seem very appealing. On the surface, I understand why. It has a "hip" vibe, an old hotel made modern, etc. The details, however, are missing.

Two primary complaints: First, there is no elevator to get to the second floor rooms. This was an unpleasant surprise, especially since my colleague and I had large suitcases. Second, the air conditioning in the rooms was horrendous! Both our rooms were hot the whole night, and complaints the next day were met with limited interest or response. Finally, for an "updated" hotel, the bathrooms are very poor. Small, not nice.

I would not stay here again. I travel over 50% of every year and stay in wonderful and not so wonderful hotels depending on where I am. This one is no better than a Holiday Inn.

review.title: Mill Valley Larkspur
review.reviewText: We used this hotel as a jumping off point to visit Muir Woods. Our room was immaculate and nicely appointed. The front desk was friendly, polite and very helpful. There is a bike/walking path in back of the hotel, on San Francisco Bay. Terrific scenery.

review.title: Good find right outside San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very clean, well maintained hotel w/nice updated amenities. Very convenient to Muir Woods.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: This is a renovated motel. Popcorn ceilings. small bathrooms with the sink outside the bathroom door, etc. Cold,drafty hallways. Sliding glass doors on the first floor that lead out onto a concrete slab by the parking lot. Weather is usually cold, windy & foggy. In the middle of a "swampy" river? with a bridge. Pictures look great compared to the actual room! Great breakfast though but very crowded. No room to eat. Nice fire pit outside in the cold to eat breakfast or cook s'mores at night (which is nice if you have kids).

review.title: Must stay!
review.reviewText: I will never stay in San Francisco again! If you like a small town feel, with no traffic, and friendly people, only 10 minutes from San Francisco, then this place is for you! The room had a super comfortable bed and the staff was very helpful and pleasant. I would stay there again in a heartbeat rather than deal with San Francisco hotel, the traffic, and the costly hotel parking and prices!

review.title: Geraldta
review.reviewText: The hotel is really clean and rooms are comfortable. However, the sound travels horribly through the walls and down the hallway. They need more insulation in the walls. The continental breakfast was decent: oatmeal, cereal, different types of breads, tea, coffee, fruit, etc. All was decent. The cost is a bit for the size of the rooms. Recommend this hotel for a one night stay. I would not recommend for a long week vacation. It was fairly noisey.

review.title: Fun
review.reviewText: Clean and beautiful. hotel located in a very scenic area. we had a very relaxing time.

review.title: Can't wait to go back. and jogging the country road.
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel with country road.
Breakfast was very good.

review.title: Weekend in Mill Valley
review.reviewText:
For the most part, the hotel was fine. It's off the freeway and convenient stay as a stop over. It's away from downtown and not accessible to many restaurants.

The continental breakfast was okay. We had a glitch in accessing the internet.

review.title: Great value for proximity to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Overall I was satisfied with the hotel at the rate that I paid.I would stay there again at that same rate. I originally booked my room at a much higher rate (on the hotel's website) but as the date of arrival grew closer, I found a non-refundable rate at more almost $50.00 less per night on Expedia. My review is based on that lower rate. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast was very good. Fresh, lots of variety and served in a lovely eating area. The room itself, while in very good repair and with a large screen tv and refridgerator, was very small. Hallways looked oldish and had a bit of a strange smell. The town of Mill Valley had almost no restaurant choices (although there is a restaurant attached to the hotel itself). Sausalito is just up street a few minutes and offered many more restaruant choices. Traffic in Mill Valley was more difficult to navigate than in San Francisco as this area is now too populated for the existing roads. Turns (both right and left) out of the hotel or other Mill Valley businesses were sometimes very difficult due to the constant stream of traffic. Assertive driving skills were a must! Again, I was satisfied for the most part and would stay at this property when I am in the area again.

review.title: excellent
review.reviewText:
location great...easy to use for Marin, easy access to SF or East bay...
room great, staff great...good continetal breakfast...quiet, great view of Mt. Tam....
wi-fi not dependable (apparently satellite, so storms make it unreliable). Overall really terrific...we will use it for all our future Bay Area trips.

review.title: not any good if you need a nights sleep
review.reviewText: on arrival and check in to say the receptionist did not enjoy her job would be understatement customer service is not her thing she was not at any point pleased to be of service, and had never heard of the word smile, to the point when my husband and i left the reception we looked at each other and said boy she had an attitude, the room was pleasant and the out side pool is nice and heated as well as a hot tub comfortable area, but don't try to find your way to reception as the corridors are not well marked, we had the staff hotel laundry next to our room and it machines were going till 10.30pm making the wall shake as well as a wedding party screaming and messing about in the corridors until early hours the rooms have no form of sound proofing and no one from the hotel was interested in quieting the noise down, breakfast was ok nothing to jump around about, when on check out a different receptionist, aventually put her phone down (Private call) i said about the issues and she just said oh sorry i'll mention it to someone, again not what i call customer service i left the hotel, most annoyed as it became a expensive bad nights sleep, and a lesson in POOR customer service

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText:
Great Hotel! Quiet and clean rooms , and friendly staff.
Will keep this one on my list of future lodging.

review.title: Quiet Place
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay away from the city. Not a great view but okay.

review.title: We will be back soon!
review.reviewText: Convenient and clean. Great side trips available at the location. Easy access to stores and a walking path near by

review.title: Good value for the money
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located for anyone visiting Sausalito or Marin County. It is nothing fancy, but the rooms are comfortable and clean, and the service is entirely satisfactory.

review.title: Worth A Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was right off the highway and the check in was a breeze. Booking online saves a lot of the hassle. The hotel is spread out so we had to drive around back to our room but it wasn't too bad. I do wish they had a an elevator. You can tell the hotel use to be old but they have renovated a lot of it. When we walked into the hallway, it smelled bad but the room was fine. On the small side but worth it with the deal I got. Super comfortable bed and pillows!!! loves having a king size bed. Nice views of wetlands from the 2nd floor. Nice flat screen t.v. It was also convenient to have an Iphone/Ipod charger/player in the room. No microwave but they had a small fridge. The snacks were in the lobby nowhere near our room, same with breakfast which was very, basic and didn't taste good. Overall, would stay here again but skip breakfast. Nice customer service though!! Quiet travelers in the rooms nearby was a plus! :)

review.title: very zen
review.reviewText:
My wife and I were very impressed with the zen-like comfort of the room. What the room lacked for in size, it more than made up for in its warmth and elegant decor. My wife's only peeve was that we were placed on the ground floor (we had a small dog) whereas she would have preferred a second-floor room with a private balcony. Being one of few pet-friendly hotels, I believe the hotel staff were only trying to accommodate our pet.
Lastly, the pillows were among the most comfortable ones we ever slept on. It prompted us to go out and try to buy the same brand of pillows used by the hotel.

review.title: would stay here again
review.reviewText: The room was great but the breakfast was dissappointing.

review.title: Wonderful Valentine's Get away
review.reviewText: This was the perfect little place for a second honey moon. Quiet, comfortable rooms and respectful staff. Nice Italian restaurant next door and a wildlife sanctuary with bike trails just steps from our room. Everything from the pillow topped king size bed to the large flat screen TV was just perfect. We'll be staying here again.

review.title: This was our Valentine's day getaway- very relaxing time
review.reviewText: Safe, nice interior, clean, met some nice people in the swimming pool which was warm. Thank you.

review.title: Would definitely return
review.reviewText: Great staff, clean rooms and nice view of the water. This is one of, if not the best, hotels in the Mill Valley area. Free wi-fi and DVD player included in my room.

review.title: Not impressive
review.reviewText: The Hotel was far away from Sausalito downtown as well as the hotel was not having the basic on-demand TV. The internet connection was very very poor.

review.title: Mt Tam and Headlands Nearby.
review.reviewText: The rooms were comfortable, clean and the staff was great. Breakfast included healthy options and good coffee. The main appeal was the fantastic location to view nature in the adjacent marshlands and take advantage of Mt Tam and Marin Headlands nearby. The complementary bikes and hike/bike path that runs directly to the hotel were another bonus. Highly recommend this hotel for any family planning to vacation in this area.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: Only there for a night but rooms were more than adequate and convenient to highway and central Mill Valley.

review.title: Great for Business
review.reviewText: They love the hotel. I am always receiving comments on how beautiful the rooms are, pleasant and attentive the staff is, and how it seems like a home away from home. Not bad for the price!

review.title: would use it again but a different room
review.reviewText: I thuoght the place was very nice and the breakfast was outstanding

review.title: great alternative to san francisco
review.reviewText: convenient to saualito and ferry service to SF. very close to Muir Woods and great restaurants.

review.title: Comfy hotel in a great location
review.reviewText:
Stayed here one night with my wife and was very impressed.

First of all, the location of the hotel is great. It is right off highway 101 with easy access to Sausalito (5 mins) /San Francisco (10 mins) or northbound access to Sonoma/Napa wine country (30 mins). The hotel sits right in some marshland area with great walking/running trails along the water. I overheard the front desk clerk saying they also rent out bikes.

Check in was quick and easy and took about 5 minutes.

The room itself was good sized, not large but comfortable enough (we booked a "Superior King". It was clear that this hotel has been recently updated. It is very modern with a huge flatscreen TV. I was also surprised that some HD channels were also included. Most hotels that have nice HD screens feed crappy SD signals into it, completely defeating the purpose of having a HDTV. TV also comes with a DVD player.

The bed was super comfortable, as were the pillows. Everything was clean. Bathroom was also very nice (albeit a bit small). The room also has a nice little balcony overlooking the water if you're on the right side.

Last and most important, the hotel was nice and quiet. I am a light sleeper and I did not hear any door slamming, ice machines, freeway noise, or anything all night. Mix that with a comfy bed and you'll sleep well.

All in all we were very pleased with our one night stay and will definitely be back.

review.title: I would stay there again
review.reviewText: It was a fantastic place. The pool was warm, i wanted to stay again but the expedite internet price was gone. coming from Michigan, it was EXCELLENT! ( and I have been known as Mr. Critical

review.title: Excellent stay.
review.reviewText:
We had a great five night stay at the Larkspur Mill Valley. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Grounds were beautifully kept, including the pool and spa area. Outdoor fireplace was nice for enjoying a bottle of wine in the evenings. Rooms were spacious and the beds very comfortable. Enjoyed the free breakfast offered each morning.
Location was perfect, with easy access to Highways 101 & 1. Hotel was very quiet also.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: The hotel had a very nice pool area and nice bed rooms. The staff were very friendly. They offered an extensive free continental breakfast, in a very nice eating area with windows looking out onto the estuary and fire places both inside and on the outside patio. Our family enjoyed the free bikes the Larkspur provides and we explored the estuary and marina on the bikes. Our son said that was the highlight of his stay. Our hotel was close to Muir Woods, the Point Reyes Coast, and Sausalito, and just short drives into San Francisco and over to the Napa Valley. My family would return to the Larkspur and recommend it to others.

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText:
Loved it
Great breakfast too

review.title: Would be great quiet place to go back to!
review.reviewText: Larspur was very nice. Very quiet even tho right off the 101. Great continental breakfast. Room was big enough to be comfortable but not what I would call spacious. Right on the bay with bike/hiking trails!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was nice. Somewhat simple, but good location for enjoying outdoor activities outside the city. Free bicycle rentals was a nice little addition.

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel. Rooms are a bit small.

review.title: GREAT location for visiting National sites by San Francisco
review.reviewText: We had wanted to visit the National sites around San Francisco and not knowing the area took our best guess as to where to stay. Our stay was for 3 nights and we were able to visit the sites in San Francisco on the way there and then visited Muir Woods and the National Seashore and other sites: Rosie the Revitor, Eugene O'Neill's home. John Muir's home, etc.

review.title: Great experience.
review.reviewText: We were pleasantly surprised. Great location and very nice, updated facility, great work out room, and nice breakfast bar. The restaurant next door was fabulous and clearly very popular with an epicurious clientele. The location was perfect for touring the Muir Woods area and Sausalito.

review.title: Very Satisfied.
review.reviewText: We were looking for a peaceful place to relax after a full day of touring San Francisco. It was nice to have the little patio overlooking Richardson Bay. The beds were very comfortable, and the big screen tv was a plus. The continental breakfast was much appreciated. There was plenty of variety and they were constantly stocking it, so that nothing ever ran out. I would stay here again, if I'm ever in the area.

review.title: Would visit again.
review.reviewText: We we happy with the hotel. Our only disappointment was that when we were told that we had a view of the "bay", it was really a view of the freeway in which the "bay" water ran underneath the freeway. The room was nice and comfortable, great flat screen t.v. and a nice continiental breakfast. We would stay there again but ask for the view of the "mountain".

review.title: Great hotel, all in all
review.reviewText: This hotel has been refurbished and the rooms are large and very comfortable. The location of the hotel makes it a little difficult to get in to San Francisco at weekends because of the ferry services however it's great for exploring the coast. The staff at the hotel were very helpful when we needed them and the Italian restaurant next to the hotel was very good indeed - we had one of our best meals at this restaurant. The only disappointing thing about the hotel was the quality of the breakfast. Admittedly it was free however we stayed in a number of hotels with free breakfasts and it was pretty poor, plus the way it was arranged left a giant scrum and nowhere to sit. Disappointing because otherwise the hotel itself was great.

review.title: Mill Valley for Pet Lovers
review.reviewText:
I liked staying at this hotel because it was a clean and convenient pet friendly with bike trail access and a dog park off the path. Perfect location for a short drive to Stinson Beach (20-25 min) and right next to the freeway. There is a lot of traffic in front of the hotel, but it didn't bother me.

Front Desk: The woman working the front desk was helpful and so very nice. She looked up some pet friendly restaurants and drew me a map to Larkspur where the Food and Flower festival was.

Pool: Great pool, spa, and cabana area. Very nice and updated.

Surrounding Area: I love the bike trails, and on site Italian food (although a bit expensive) and a 5 minute drive can get you to just about any food you could want. Cool surf shop and a Wallgreens about two minutes away.

review.title: Good Choice
review.reviewText: Good place at a very fair price.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText:
This non-chain hotel is quiet, well-maintained and has a California feel to it--especially the patio with fire pit looking out over a bird sanctuary that is surrounded by cyclists and runners. There's a view of Mt. Tam and proximity to the outdoors activities that are more popular north of San Francisco, including Muir Woods. The hotel is actually located in a built-up area of chain stores and restaurants, but if you look off to the west, the setting is more picturesque.

I'd recommend the hotel for Marin tourists and for others who, like me, have business nearby (San Anselmo, in my case) and are looking for a bit of quiet, a pleasant view., and a place to walk or jog.

Oh, and there is a modest breakfast that's free with the room.

review.title: Great location outside of the city
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed here during a trip that included Napa, Mill Valley, Monterey, and San Francisco. This hotel was in an excellent location for us to take day easy day trips to Point Reyes, Muir Woods, and Sausalito. Tee hotel is very modern and the rooms are very large with a small patio/porch. We especially enjoyed taking a couple bottles of wine we brought from Napa out onto the patio off of the lobby. It was pretty cool at night, but it was nice to sit around the fire pit. Great place to stay but you really need a car to get around from here. It is a pretty far walk to the ferry stops in Sausalito. Otherwise this is a great hotel.

review.title: great place to stay just north of SF
review.reviewText: The hotel was great- pool, hot tub, business computers, breakfast. Our family had a great stay.

review.title: AWESOME HOTEL
review.reviewText: On arrival our online reservation was ready, we had no wait time. Upon entering the room the first thing we noticed was the amazing new flat screen 40+ in TV. LOVED it. THe room itself was very nice and cozy and then we walked out on the balcony (we were on the1st floor facing the river area.) we were greeted by a short walk to the most gorgeous waterway area. Breakfast was nice, quick and very efficient. It had cereals, muffins, breads, yogurt, eggs, various drinks. Nice start to a nice day. The freeways were very close as were many amazing restaurants and alot of stores nearby. One complaint is it can be hard when the road in front of the hotel is busy to get out of the parking lot. We had to be quick and time it right. As for the rest NO COMPLAINTS!!!! We will definiately come back here in the future OH and one more thing all our business was in SF but staying across the river and taking the Ferry over we DIDNT have to pay for our parking at the hotel!!!!

review.title: Major pleaser!
review.reviewText: The hotel has recently been ungraded so that everything is there and works well! Breakfast was great, business center, large screen TV and quiet and clean rooms. Would hope to stay there again!!!

review.title: Perfect stay - plan on returning
review.reviewText: I am glad to be the first to review this hotel. I had read somewhere that the hotel had been renovated, and it looks it, as everything was new and the decor was sort of like relaxed Pottery Barn. I did not have a car during this stay, so at first I was upset upon arriving at the Marin Airporter stop on Manzanita Avenue of possibly being stranded and not knowing how to get around, but I was happy to learn that Sausalito was a short taxi drive away, as was the Ferry if you want to go into the city. Since my primary reason for this stay was relaxation and hitting some of the local nature sites, my mission was accomplished. The hotel is literally across the street from the Richardson Bay sanctuary, so it's a beautiful walk in the morning or afternoon, with Mt. Tam in the distance and the hills surrounding you. Muir Woods is also not far off, although I did not have time to go there. The breakfast was generous and staff was immensely helpful, thank you so much Robert, Helen, and another young lady whose name I did not get, who helped me get a taxi and answer my questions. It was so refreshing to experience such friendliness, even a kind stranger drove me down Shoreline Highway to the hotel a few hundred yards away, as I was walking back from Sausalito in the rain and getting quite drenched! The rain was not a downer - it resulted in the most beautiful rainbow over the bay! Thank you Larkspur Hotel Mill Valley for a perfect stay. - Antonia G.
